solution_line_template: If the first snail traveled the distance in {first_snail_time} minutes, then the second snail, traveling at twice the rate of speed, would take {first_snail_time}/{second_snail_speed_multiplier}=<<{first_snail_time}/{second_snail_speed_multiplier}={second_snail_time}>>{second_snail_time} minutes to complete the race.

If the third snail raced at five times the speed of the second snail, then it would take the third snail {second_snail_time}/{third_snail_speed_multiplier}=<<{second_snail_time}/{third_snail_speed_multiplier}={third_snail_time}>>{third_snail_time} minutes to race all the way up the sidewalk.
